lead_paragraph: KIMMELMAN--Miriam E.,of Battery Park City, New York, widow of Richard Washburn, born September 16, 1948, died after a short illness on January 7, 2016. She is survived by her cousins: Ruth Golan, Yehuda Yuval, Meira Yablunka and Ora Zamir, all residing in Israel with their 11 children. Miriam was a founding member of the Dystonia Medical Research Foundation (DMRF) New York City Chapter, devoted to research, education and support for those affected by dystonia. Miriam met neurosurgical pioneer Irving S. Cooper MD, in November 1961 and underwent three brain surgeries between the ages 13 and 21 to alleviate her dystonic symptoms. She was a strong advocate for dystonia research, providing financial support for DMRF and donating her brain to advance understanding of this rare disorder. Mriam worked for over 40 years for New York State as a Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor, helping people with disabilities to reach their potential. Miriam and her husband were instrumental in the creation of the Liberty Community Gardens in 1987. After 9/11 she and others fought to have the gardens saved and replaced to their current location. Plans for a memorial service TBA. Donations in her memory should be made to the Dystonia Medical Research Foundation, 1 E Wacker Dr, Ste. 2810, Chicago, Illinois 60601. 1/3
